<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">U.S. economy: </strong></span><span>After </span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/us-manufacturing-sector-weakens-further-in-november---ism-2019-12-02?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">contracting <em>again</em></a></span><span> in November, the manufacturing sector is now hitless in its last four at-bats. “Global trade remains the most significant cross-industry issue,” said the chair of the Institute for Supply Management’s manufacturing business survey committee. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Speaking of trade:</strong></span><span> President Trump announced he would put </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/02/politics/donald-trump-steel-aluminum-tariffs-brazil-argentina/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tariffs</a></span><span> on steel and aluminum imports from Brazil and Argentina, accusing those countries of “massive devaluation of their currencies.” But there’s </span><span><span>little</span></span><span> evidence Brazil and Argentina have been manipulating their currencies.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">It keeps coming: </strong></span><span>The U.S. </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-02/u-s-proposes-2-4-billion-in-tariffs-on-france-over-digital-tax?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">proposed tariffs</a></span><span> on ~$2.4 billion in French products in retaliation for a French tax on Big Tech.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Plz make it stop: </strong></span><span>All this news sent the S&P to its </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/02/dow-futures-point-to-higher-open-as-traders-monitor-us-china-trade.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest one-day slide</a></span><span> since early October.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/02/china-russia-open-monumental-gas-pipeline?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
China and Russia Pass Gas
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc1MzIyMDc5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, China and Russia opened a <a href="https://apnews.com/7ef3a0af0d9f4bf5890eec87b7e0a857?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monumental gas pipeline</a> that further cements their economic and political <span>relationship</span>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The pipeline, known as the Power of Siberia, cost $55 billion and runs 1,800 miles from Siberian gas fields to </span><span><span>China's northern border</span></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>By 2025, it will carry the equivalent of Brazil’s annual gas consumption—38 billion cubic meters, </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-and-russia-are-partnersand-now-have-a-55-billion-pipeline-to-prove-it-11575225030?mod=itp_wsj&mod=&mod=djemITP_h&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the WSJ notes</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Shivers up your spine </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the U.S., this pipeline launch is like seeing the Joker and Bane on a tandem bicycle. By opening the pipeline, China and Russia are pulling the geopolitical epicenter of the world ever so slowly to the East.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How this happened: </strong>Russia was hit with Western sanctions following its annexation of the Crimean Peninsula in 2014. Blockaded from many business dealings with the U.S. and Europe, Russia turned to other countries for an economic lifeline.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">China: "Hey" </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://pixel.nymag.com/imgs/daily/vulture/2018/10/05/star/star-is-born-1.w600.h315.2x.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Image result for a star is born car"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>Warner Bros.</em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2014, the state-owned Russian gas company Gazprom inked a 30-year, $400 billion gas supply contract with China National Petroleum Corp. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The partnership is a </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia-pacific/a-huge-siberian-gas-pipeline-binds-russia-and-china-as-gas-flows-for-the-first-time/2019/12/02/35250ff8-14f7-11ea-80d6-d0ca7007273f_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">win-win</a></span><span>. China’s got the demand (</span><span><span>it’s expected to be</span></span><span> the world’s largest gas importer next year) and Russia’s got the goods (it’s guarding the world’s largest proven gas reserves). And both want to rile up the U.S. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the China-Russia embrace also extends to other sectors. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Telecom: </strong></span><span>China’s Huawei is </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/russia-mts-5g-huawei-deal-tech-cold-war-2019-6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">developing 5G networks</a></span><span> in Russia through a deal with MTS, Russia’s largest </span><span><span>mobile </span></span><span>network provider. Huawei is the U.S. national security community’s public enemy </span><span><span>No. 1</span></span><span>.  </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Currency: </strong></span><span>The Chinese yuan in March accounted for 14.2% of Russia’s foreign currency reserves, up from 5% last year. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Trade: </strong></span><span>In 2018, trade between the two countries topped $100 billion, a record. Russian President Vladimir Putin wants bilateral trade turnover to reach $200 billion in 2024. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Now that Russia and China are pipeline official, it’ll be more important than ever for the U.S. to cooperate with its Western allies.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/02/nato-celebrates-70th-birthdayin-london?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
And...That Might Not Happen Right Away
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As Russia cozies up to China, its rivals are <a href="https://apnews.com/bf0e8dbfec554a048f77b55a8e52f37b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">meeting in London</a> at the NATO summit. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>NATO, or the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, was created after World War II to counter Soviet aggression. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It has 29 member states across North America and Europe.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But group projects are frustrating, especially when Albania didn't do any work but takes all the credit. Recently, members have been bickering over how much each is contributing to the military cause. In 2014, NATO members agreed to spend 2% of their respective GDPs on defense <span>by 2024</span>, but not all are on track to meet that target.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Trump is not happy about that, while French President Emmanuel Macron <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nato-meeting-overshadowed-by-frances-macron-11575302536?mod=hp_lista_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> ahead of the summit that NATO is experiencing "brain death."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s a chart from <a href="https://www.gzeromedia.com/graphic-truth-natos-budget?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">GZERO Media</a> showing where NATO members stand in meeting the 2% defense <span>spending </span>target.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1575314501.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://www.gzeromedia.com/graphic-truth-natos-budget?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>GZERO Media</em></a></sup></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/02/facebook-testing-new-tool-let-transfer-photos-google?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Laverne & Shirley, Bert and Ernie, Facebook and Google
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know what Google Photos needs? More pictures of you wearing popped-collar Abercrombie polos edited on Picnik. Thank goodness Facebook is starting to let users <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/12/2/20991419/facebook-transfer-photos-google-photos-tool-new-details?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">transfer their media</a> directly to Google Photos.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>The new tool lays the rails for <a href="https://www.engadget.com/2019/12/02/facebook-portable-data-photos/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bulk export</a>, meaning you don’t have to individually save and re-upload every brutal mirror selfie from 2008 on. It’s only available for testing in Ireland, but it’s set to roll out worldwide in 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The collab is part of the open-source <strong style="color:#000">Data Transfer Project</strong>. What it <a href="https://www.engadget.com/2018/07/20/google-facebook-microsoft-data-transfer-project/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">means</a> to be DTP:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The </span><span><a href="https://datatransferproject.dev/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">project</a></span><span> (est. 2018) includes FB and Google, plus Apple, Microsoft, Twitter, and more.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It aims to “enable people to freely move their information across the web” in order to foster competition and </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/02/facebook-releases-new-data-portability-tool-for-photos.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">consumer choice</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Facebook has preached so-called data portability for some time, and this tool will grow beyond Google Photos to other services. Big Tech might have antitrust busters foaming at the mouth, but portability initiatives like this one could throw them off the scent.</p>

</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHILANTHROPY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/02/charity-measured-cent?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Crunching the Numbers for Giving Tuesday
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="giving tuesday" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://www.givingtuesday.org/sites/default/files/2019-11/Facebook%20Cover%20-%20global%20hearts.png">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giving Tuesday</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s #GivingTuesday, an annual day of philanthropy started in 2012 to <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90271843/how-giving-tuesday-became-a-worldwide-phenomenon?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">combat</a> the guilt that arrives with mountains of Amazon deliveries. Giving Tuesday brought in $400 million for nonprofits last year, but a new wave of entrepreneurs is <a href="https://www.axios.com/silicon-valley-philanthropy-charitable-giving-4e6c8e08-c581-4b8c-973b-cf4afb2bcd5e.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">conjuring up</a> more economical ways to deploy the funds.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s called “effective altruism” </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And it’s spawning a new industry dedicated to squeezing out the <a href="https://www.economist.com/international/2018/06/02/can-effective-altruism-maximise-the-bang-for-each-charitable-buck?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most juice</a> possible from your donation. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>GiveWell </span><span><a href="https://www.givewell.org/charities/top-charities?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rates charities</a></span><span> based on criteria like “evidence of effectiveness” and “</span><span><span>cost per total economic benefit to others, normalized by base income</span></span><span>.” One of its top charities is a deworming initiative in developing countries.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>ImpactMatters </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/22/your-money/ratings-charities.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rates</a></span><span> charities by their ability to maximize donor dollars. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But boiling giving down to a cost-benefit analysis is tricky. Some donors want to help the most people possible, others the soup kitchen on their block.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Giving Tuesday sits squarely in charities’ playoff season—the holidays. A bad rating could mess up donations (and operations) for months or years and send donations elsewhere.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
All Nerds Not Welcome: Why Tech’s Diversity Problem Matters
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="business casual podcast " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0NzI3Mzg5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A few weeks ago, Apple came under fire for allegedly deploying biased algorithms to determine credit limits for its Apple Card. Some women were given lower spending limits than male counterparts who had worse credit.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the aftermath, critics said Apple’s algorithmic issues were proof the humans who wrote them were inherently biased and these alleged biases had wiggled into their code.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not a one-off episode. There is a persistent gender gap in tech, and that gender gap leads to worse products for everyone. So...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week on Morning Brew’s weekly podcast <em>Business Casual</em>, </strong>we pick apart how that gender gap came to be, how it’s affecting the bottom line, and why you should care. To explain it all, we spoke with Reshma Saujani, founder and CEO of Girls Who Code.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen to the podcast: </strong><a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Reshma_Apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Reshma_Spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Reshma_All?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, China and Russia opened a \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/7ef3a0af0d9f4bf5890eec87b7e0a857?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emonumental gas pipeline\u003c/a\u003e that further cements their economic and political \u003cspan\u003erelationship\u003c/span\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe pipeline, known as the Power of Siberia, cost $55 billion and runs 1,800 miles from Siberian gas fields to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChina's northern border\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBy 2025, it will carry the equivalent of Brazil’s annual gas consumption—38 billion cubic meters, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-and-russia-are-partnersand-now-have-a-55-billion-pipeline-to-prove-it-11575225030?mod=itp_wsj\u0026mod=\u0026mod=djemITP_h\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe WSJ notes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eShivers up your spine \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the U.S., this pipeline launch is like seeing the Joker and Bane on a tandem bicycle. By opening the pipeline, China and Russia are pulling the geopolitical epicenter of the world ever so slowly to the East.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow this happened: \u003c/strong\u003eRussia was hit with Western sanctions following its annexation of the Crimean Peninsula in 2014. Blockaded from many business dealings with the U.S. and Europe, Russia turned to other countries for an economic lifeline.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eChina: \"Hey\" \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://pixel.nymag.com/imgs/daily/vulture/2018/10/05/star/star-is-born-1.w600.h315.2x.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"Image result for a star is born car\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eWarner Bros.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2014, the state-owned Russian gas company Gazprom inked a 30-year, $400 billion gas supply contract with China National Petroleum Corp. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe partnership is a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia-pacific/a-huge-siberian-gas-pipeline-binds-russia-and-china-as-gas-flows-for-the-first-time/2019/12/02/35250ff8-14f7-11ea-80d6-d0ca7007273f_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewin-win\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. China’s got the demand (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eit’s expected to be\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the world’s largest gas importer next year) and Russia’s got the goods (it’s guarding the world’s largest proven gas reserves). And both want to rile up the U.S. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the China-Russia embrace also extends to other sectors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTelecom: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChina’s Huawei is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/russia-mts-5g-huawei-deal-tech-cold-war-2019-6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeveloping 5G networks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in Russia through a deal with MTS, Russia’s largest \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003emobile \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003enetwork provider. Huawei is the U.S. national security community’s public enemy \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNo. 1\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCurrency: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Chinese yuan in March accounted for 14.2% of Russia’s foreign currency reserves, up from 5% last year. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrade: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2018, trade between the two countries topped $100 billion, a record. Russian President Vladimir Putin wants bilateral trade turnover to reach $200 billion in 2024. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eNow that Russia and China are pipeline official, it’ll be more important than ever for the U.S. to cooperate with its Western allies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Google\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou know what Google Photos needs? More pictures of you wearing popped-collar Abercrombie polos edited on Picnik. Thank goodness Facebook is starting to let users \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/12/2/20991419/facebook-transfer-photos-google-photos-tool-new-details?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etransfer their media\u003c/a\u003e directly to Google Photos.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eThe new tool lays the rails for \u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/2019/12/02/facebook-portable-data-photos/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebulk export\u003c/a\u003e, meaning you don’t have to individually save and re-upload every brutal mirror selfie from 2008 on. It’s only available for testing in Ireland, but it’s set to roll out worldwide in 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe collab is part of the open-source \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eData Transfer Project\u003c/strong\u003e. What it \u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/2018/07/20/google-facebook-microsoft-data-transfer-project/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emeans\u003c/a\u003e to be DTP:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://datatransferproject.dev/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproject\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (est. 2018) includes FB and Google, plus Apple, Microsoft, Twitter, and more.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt aims to “enable people to freely move their information across the web” in order to foster competition and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/02/facebook-releases-new-data-portability-tool-for-photos.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econsumer choice\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eFacebook has preached so-called data portability for some time, and this tool will grow beyond Google Photos to other services. Big Tech might have antitrust busters foaming at the mouth, but portability initiatives like this one could throw them off the scent.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s #GivingTuesday, an annual day of philanthropy started in 2012 to \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90271843/how-giving-tuesday-became-a-worldwide-phenomenon?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" Giving Tuesday brought in $400 million for nonprofits last year, but a new wave of entrepreneurs is \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/silicon-valley-philanthropy-charitable-giving-4e6c8e08-c581-4b8c-973b-cf4afb2bcd5e.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s called “effective altruism” \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd it’s spawning a new industry dedicated to squeezing out the \u003ca href=\"https://www.economist.com/international/2018/06/02/can-effective-altruism-maximise-the-bang-for-each-charitable-buck?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost juice\u003c/a\u003e possible from your donation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eGiveWell \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.givewell.org/charities/top-charities?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erates charities\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e based on criteria like “evidence of effectiveness” and “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003ecost per total economic benefit to others, normalized by base income\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.” One of its top charities is a deworming initiative in developing countries.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eImpactMatters \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/22/your-money/ratings-charities.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erates\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e charities by their ability to maximize donor dollars. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut boiling giving down to a cost-benefit analysis is tricky.
